subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Do you get VERY tired from your sessions?
author: Robin Searcy Henson
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0074_01C87A00.8A4E11E0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I would guess it's very common because it's literally a spiritual-mental-em=
otional-physical energy drain.  For the last two nights I've been listening=
 to my hacked radios in my motel room, without recording, just to get in-tu=
ned with them.  I've gotten totally ovewhelmed with exhaustion both times, =
to the point of having to stop within 10 minutes.  I agree that it's not re=
lated to physical stamina.  The sessions are draining for them on the other=
 side too, right?  Do you recover from your tiredness momentarily or does i=
t take some time?  I've felt kind of "hung over" the next day, and the tire=
dness is lingering.

Robin


----- Original Message ----- 
  From: dead.sci=
ence<mailto:dead.science@...> 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:E=
VP-ITC@yahoogroups.com> 
  Sent: Wednesday, February 27, 2008 11:34 PM
  Su=
bject: [EVP-ITC] Do you get VERY tired from your sessions?


  I get very v=
ery tired from my sessions. I try to keep them to 10 min.
  because of this=
. Please remember I run marathons and have been a ham
  for over 20 years s=
o I can listen to the radio for hours on end. I am
  not certain why this i=
s happening. Just wondering if anybody has this
  problem.
  Rob.
